No wonder he was rejected by the system, he was much better than it.
Don Owen was one the best Canadian directors to be able to put together a shot, create intrigue, and show the divide between generations.
Mise en scène is suberb. Owen transforms a reg doc into equivalent of 60s Euro art film. Similar to Veronique et son cancre and 400 blows.
Can't imagine anyone saying they care about Canadian cinema and not want to restore Owen's Ibiza doc.I'm sure it's one of his, and our, best
I'd definitively contribute $$ to help restore Owen's Ibiza doc. One of the greatest Canadian filmmakers,and it's unfair how neglected he is
It's as if we knew where a full cut of von Stroheim's Greed or any other lost masterpiece was and did nothing.Owen deserves the restoration.
One of major disappointment in Canadian cinema is nobody wants to restore Don Owen's long thought to be lost Ibiza documentary.
Cowboy and Indian is great, and so is Notes for a Film. Glimpse of Joey an You Don't Back Down are the major discoveries.
